results.title: Somazone (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Jones, Tom Olsson, Electric Alchemy, National Asthma Campaign, Legal Aid Commission of Victoria, Quit, Human Services and Cinemedia
results.brief_description: SomaZone is about exploring, experimenting and making choices. It’s a “Life-Simulator” which gives teenagers a chance for real decision-making. By creating a “personal body”, users can take risks and see what happens. SomaZone is a multimedia package designed to look at health, society and the law from the perspective of adolescents. Discussion notes are included in the CD in WORD format. Technical requirements: Will run on PC and MAC. PC’s need Windows 3.1 or later; 486 - 66 CPU; 6MB of free RAM; 2 x CD-ROM drive; SVGA (256 colours); 16 bit Soundblaster or compatible; Quicktime for Windows 2.1.2 (supplied). Macintosh: System 7 or later; 030 - 30MHz; 6 MB of free Ram; 2 x CD-ROM drive; 256 colours; Quicktime 2.5 supplied.

results.title: Solving linear equations with one variable
results.creator_credit: Mark M Williams, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program introduces solving linear equations with one variable when the variable is a natural number. Students will be shown basic rules that will allow them to solve this type of equation. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Solomon Islands
results.creator_credit: Denmark, U-V Film and Video and Leif Stubkjaer,
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
This film examines the rich traditional and village life which continues alongside the adaption to modern ways. The Solomon Islands are a place of extreme contrasts even as the tides of change gradually affect these islands.

results.title: Papua New Guinea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
The largest of the newly independent South Pacific Nations (1975), Papua New Guinea, embodies many of the complexities facing the region. Papua New Guinea’s land mass includes vast mountain regions, fertile river valleys, coastal flat lands and tropical islands. More than 700 languages are spoken. Old enmities and conflicts still linger on. The greatest challenge facing PNG is to bind its people together in the spirit of one nation. The film looks at the distinctive Huli people, traditional and contemporary life and the challenges which face this exciting nation.

results.title: Western Samoa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
The nine islands forming Western Samoa are the heartland of Polynesia. Western Samoa became the first independent South Pacific nation in 1962. Christianity first reached the islands in 1830 and was embraced enthusiastically. Many of its values complemented the Samoan customs. Today these forces co-exist in harmony and the national motto is “Samoa is founded on God”. A fast growing population and changing trade patterns are among the challenges which Samoa is facing. The film examines contemporary issues and trends from the Samoans’ own viewpoints.

results.title: Writing equations of lines
results.creator_credit: Carla Cody Weaver, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program introduces the opposite concept of other programs in the “Algebra, you can do it” series and teaches students how to find the equation if something is known about the graph through a step by step exercises. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: The Kingdom of Tonga
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Oceans of Dreams - Currents of Change Series”.
The last Pacific Kingdom, Tonga, has a unique history, social and political system. Tonga was the only Pacific nation not to be colonised. Its special relationship of friendship and protection by Britain gave way to complete independence in 1970. Today, Tonga is devoutly Christian, with strong traditional values and attitudes. It faces the problem of a rising population, decreasing supply of land and the changes which affect all Pacific nations. Tonga has countered some of the challenges by a policy of encouraging light industry and tourism. Its other safety valve is migration; an estimated 25 per cent of Tongans live abroad and the film examines this issue as well as portraying contemporary life in Tonga.

results.title: Graphing linear equations
results.creator_credit: Carla Cody Weaver, Bill Hanlon and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program shows how to graph a linear equation by finding the value for x and y. It also familiarises students with the correct vocabulary to use when describing linear equations. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.
